entry.title: Amazon to Invest up to $4B in AI Firm Anthropic
entry.summary: Along with the cash injection, Anthropic will also have access to Amazon Web Services and assist with developing the firm's native chips.

entry.title: Hong Kong Financial Watchdog to Bring JPEX 'Wrong-Doers to Justice'
entry.summary: After the JPEX incident, Hong Kong's SFC is tightening up, announcing it would reveal all the crypto firms vying for a license.

entry.title: Mixin Platform Suspends Deposits, Withdrawals After $200M Security Breach
entry.summary: Mixin Network hacked for up to $200 million, raising centralization concerns.

entry.title: Terra Classic Community Votes to End Minting, Reminting of USTC Tokens
entry.summary: About 59% of voters were in favor of the move, which comes more than a year after the original Terra Luna collapsed.

entry.title: Writers Guild, Studios Reach Tentative Deal Covering AI, Streaming Services
entry.summary: The provisional agreement is said to have "groundbreaking additions" related to the use of AI in film and TV writing.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Ryan Ozawa

entry.title: South Korea’s UpBit Temporarily Freezes Withdrawals Following Scam Token Airdrop
entry.summary: South Korea’s largest cryptocurrency exchange halted deposits after detecting what it said was an abnormal amount of deposit attempts related to a scam token.

entry.title: Inscription Craze Leaves Thousands of Bitcoin Transactions Unconfirmed
entry.summary: The network currently has 393,000 unconfirmed transactions stretching as far back as April. For some, that’s a good thing.

entry.title: Coinbase Bitcoin Holdings Rival Those of Cryptocurrency Creator Satoshi Nakamoto: Arkham
entry.summary: The company says that Coinbase holds the most Bitcoin on its network with an identified $25 billion in reserves.

entry.title: Minecraft Server Will End Bitcoin Earnings After Mojang Demand: Report
entry.summary: Satlantis, a Minecraft server that pays users Bitcoin, announced that it will kill the feature. Mojang’s rules now prohibit it.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: 11,000 Venezuelan Soldiers Bring Down Jailhouse Bitcoin Mining Operation
entry.summary: An earlier raid of a suspected drug running operation in Santiago also turned up Bitcoin hardware, but the Venezuela operation was magnitudes larger.

entry.title: Will SEC's 'Stoner Cats' Action Have a Chilling Effect on NFT Media Projects?
entry.summary: The SEC charges against Mila Kunis' "Stoner Cats" has other film and TV creators on edge about their own use of NFTs to crowdfund projects.

entry.title: OpenSea API Users Warned of Third-Party Security Breach
entry.summary: Customers who connect online services to the NFT marketplace are told to swap out their keys.

entry.title: Coinbase CEO Calls for Deregulation of Artificial Intelligence
entry.summary: Brian Armstrong says passing laws "has unintended consequences and kills competition."

entry.title: Why Has Stablecoin Legislation Stalled? Blockchain Association CEO Explains
entry.summary: “The number one challenge is explaining these innovations,” said Kristin Smith.

entry.title: London's Digital Fashion Week Showcased the Industry's Bold Future
entry.summary: Technology has added a much-needed freshness to London Fashion Week, extending creativity into the boundless digital domain.

entry.title: Regulators Are 'Hurting Their Own Country' in Seeking Encryption Backdoors: Nym CEO
entry.summary: Harry Halpin said the UK’s mandate will drive people who require privacy to leave the country.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Slow News is Good News for Bitcoin and Ethereum
entry.summary: Also, no rate hike from the Federal Reserves may stem risk-averse crypto outflows.

entry.title: Police Seize Bitcoin Mining Machines in Venezuelan Prison Bust
entry.summary: Authorities say the machines were found when 11,000 troops raided the Tocorón prison this week.

entry.title: Microsoft Reveals Major AI Upgrades for Windows, Office, and Bing
entry.summary: Microsoft is integrating AI capabilities like Copilot and DALL-E 3 across its consumer products, aiming to lead the AI assistant race.

entry.title: Amazon Adds Self-Publishing Restrictions to Counter Flood of AI Books
entry.summary: Amazon updates its guidelines mandating disclosure of AI-generated content to curb low-quality ebooks that are claimed to be written by humans.

entry.title: Unity Apologizes, Walks Back Fee Changes After Game Developer Backlash
entry.summary: Game engine giant Unity isn’t killing its despised runtime fee, but it is offering developers options to avoid it or otherwise reduce costs.

entry.title: Bitcoin Critic Senator Menendez Charged With Corruption, Bribery
entry.summary: Senator Menendez, a long-time critic of Bitcoin and other crypto for its alleged association with criminals, faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted.

entry.title: Gucci's Milan Fashion Week Show Debuts on Roblox and Zepeto
entry.summary: Gucci creative director Sabato de Sarno's first runway show for the fashion giant is also now in the metaverse.

entry.title: European Parliament Calls for Tighter Oversight of Global Cryptocurrency Market
entry.summary: A European regulatory framework targeting digital assets should be in greater accord with global efforts, argues new research.

entry.title: 'Twitter Is Where Financial Conversation Happens': Why eToro Partnered With Elon Musk
entry.summary: eToro US CEO Lule Demmissie joined Decrypt Markets Editor at Messari Mainnet 2023 to discuss the impact of the recent Ripple vs. SEC court decision on retail traders and why the social trading platform partnered with Elon Musk's Twitter.

entry.title: Why Has Stablecoin Legislation Stalled? Blockchain Association’s Kristin Smith Explains
entry.summary: Blockchain Association CEO Kristin Smith joined Decrypt reporter André Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023 to talk cryptocurrency regulation, the status of pending stablecoin legislation, and why Congress has struggled to reach consensus.

entry.title: Huddle01 CEO Ayush Ranjan on Why Decentralized Audio and Video Infrastructure is Needed
entry.summary: Huddle01 co-founder and CEO Ayush Ranjan joined Decrypt reporter André Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023 to discuss the "people-powered communications network," which provides audio and video capabilities via a decentralized network and can be integrated into social media platforms.

entry.title: FTX Claims Trading Near 35% of Debt Amount in Secondary Markets
entry.summary: Analysts found that investors are actively purchasing claims with an expectation of strong returns as the settlement progresses.

entry.title: The Island Onboards Museums to On-Chain Art: ‘There is Something to Gain for Both Worlds’
entry.summary: The platform aims to onboard traditional artists and institutions to the blockchain while bringing museum-quality standards to Web3 art.

entry.title: FTX Files $157 Million Lawsuit Against Ex-Employees of Hong Kong Affiliate
entry.summary: The lawsuit alleges that four ex-staffers used their connections to pull their money out first when FTX's stability was in question.

entry.title: Binance and CEO Changpeng Zhao Seek Dismissal of SEC Lawsuit, Citing Regulatory Overreach
entry.summary: The crypto exchange accuses the U.S. regulator of misinterpreting securities laws and retroactively imposing its authority.

entry.title: Nansen Users’ Blockchain Addresses Exposed in Security Breach
entry.summary: The crypto analytics firm reported that some password hashes and blockchain addresses were exposed, along with email addresses.

entry.title: South Korean Mobile Developer NHN Is Building Crypto Games on Sui
entry.summary: Another notable South Korean publisher embraces blockchain gaming, this time on Sui in partnership with Mysten Labs.

entry.title: The Elder Scrolls VI: Everything You Need to Know
entry.summary: Skyrim can only hold a fantasy fan's attention for so long. Luckily, The Elder Scrolls VI is officially on the horizon. Here's the latest.

entry.title: Nym CEO Harry Halpin on Why Regulators Push Back Against Privacy Tech
entry.summary: Nym CEO Harry Halpin sat down with Decrypt Markets Editor Stacy Elliott at Messari Mainnet 2023 to discuss Nym and how mixnets work, increasing regulatory pushback to privacy-protecting technologies, and why he remains optimistic in the face of such resistance.

entry.title: Nirvana Bassist Says AI Could Help Complete Old Demo Songs
entry.summary: Krist Novoselic says he's interested in using AI to finish new Nirvana songs from old scraps—after using the tech on concert recordings.

entry.title: Insider Trading Ahead of Cisco’s $28 Billion Splunk Acquisition?
entry.summary: One "lucky" trader appears to have turned $22,000 into $10 million betting on SPLK, a 46,000% return.

entry.title: 'Not Only Me': Actor Anil Kapoor Wins AI Deepfake Court Case
entry.summary: "Every actor has the right to protect themselves and their rights," said Slumdog Millionaire star Anil Kapoor after the Indian court verdict.

entry.title: Financial Regulator Issues 'Final Warning' to Non-Compliant UK Crypto Firms
entry.summary: The FCA says the vast majority of crypto firms in the U.K. have yet to reply to the regulator's questions regarding new standards set to come into effect.

entry.title: YouTube Adds AI Features to Enhance and Simplify Video Creation
entry.summary: Google has unveiled new AI-powered features to bolster video creation on YouTube for both Shorts and long-form clips.

entry.title: Tim Draper Launches Crypto Accelerator Despite US Regulatory 'Shitshow,' Says Partner
entry.summary: Billionaire investor Tim Draper's new Draper Goren Blockchain will have 10-year time horizons and aim to help build companies from scratch.

entry.title: 'Bottle Shock' Film Director Plots Animated Musical Remake—Funded by NFTs
entry.summary: The "Bottle Shock" revival will reimagine the original live-action Alan Rickman wine film. Its creators say NFT holders will profit if the film sells to a distributor.

entry.title: CBDC Anti-Surveillance Bill Passes House Committee Despite Push Back From Democrats
entry.summary: Majority Whip Tom Emmer’s (R-MN) CBDC Anti-Surveillance State Act is now headed for a vote before the House.

entry.title: Avantgarde Finance: DeFi Didn't Soar After FTX, But It Hasn't Declined Either
entry.summary: Avantgarde Finance CEO and founder Mona El Isa talks about how DeFi has changed (and hasn't) changed since the collapse of FTX and what it takes to get more passively managed products onchain.

entry.title: Will Base Ever Have a Token? 'Not Something We've Ruled Out Entirely,' Says Coinbase's Paul Grewal
entry.summary: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer talks to Decrypt's Andre Beganski about the recent Uniswap court ruling, tokenizing its Base L2, and the company's own battle for clearer regulations in the U.S..

entry.title: Shrapnel Studio Head Talks Unity Fees and Game Industry Challenges
entry.summary: Shrapnel's Head of Studio Don Norbury shares his perspective on the "tumultuous" video games industry and the Unity fee news that's upset developers with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Max Zim talks Memecoins and SocialFi - This Time Will Be Different
entry.summary: Max and Reza dive into conversations about the current memecoin meta, the rising popularity of SocialFi and social tokens, and discuss lessons learned from big wins and big losses.

entry.title: Here's How Much Bitcoin We Earned Playing Minecraft
entry.summary:
Update: the Bitcoin earning functionality will be removed from the Satlantis server on September 25. Full report: https://decrypt.co/198541/minecraft-server-end-bitcoin-earnings-after-mojang-demand-report
Original description: You can now mine Bitcoin in Minecraft. Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shows us how.
Satlantis website: https://satlantis.net/ Minecraft server address: play.satlantis.net

entry.title: Gods Unchained's Daniel Paez on the Future of NFT Gaming Interoperability
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, executive producer on NFT card-battling game Gods Unchained, speaks with Decrypt Culture Editor Andrew Hayward about what the future of NFT game interoperability will really look like—and what it won't.

entry.title: How Mino Games is Using Artificial Intelligence
entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha McKinnon tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the studio's upcoming game Dimensionals will use real-time AI.

entry.title: INTERVIEW: How Will Aurory Use NFTs and Crypto?
entry.summary: Michael Natoli, Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Aurory games will use NFTs and crypto and shares the studio's broader stance on the tech.

entry.title: Google Cloud's James Tromans on the Intersection of AI and Web3
entry.summary: Google's Global Head of Google Cloud for Web3 James Tromans sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson to discuss how AI can help Web3 companies come to market faster and the real value of Web3 tools.

entry.title: Mastering NFT Trading - Degen U
entry.summary: Take Degen U's new course, Mastering NFT Trading, and earn an on-chain certificate. A top instructor will help you identify trends, seize the right moment to trade, weed out scams—and have fun while doing it!

entry.title: Space Nation CEO on Working With 'Independence Day' Director Roland Emmerich
entry.summary: Jerome Wu, CEO of Space Nation, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the upcoming Space Nation Online game in development and shares details on Space Nation Cofounder Roland Emmerich's role in the project.
